resources.string: Please let us know. When compiling the amount of information from the diversity of sources that we have, inevitably, there will be a few mistakes. Since we are ultimately try to provide a source for rich linguistic information on the Asturian language, we strive for perfection. Whenever you see a mistake, tap on the menu at the top right of your screen and select "Report error…". Thank you for your help!

Application programmed by Matthew Stephen Stuckwisch. Dictionary entries provided under license by the Academy of the Asturian Language. Other linguistic information (morphology) is compiled by the rest of the team members at SoftAstur from a variety of sources including OSLIN, Eslema, and A.Ll.A.

This program (Asturian Dictionary) is free software. If not, see http://www.gnu.org/licenses for more information.
This is a feature that is still under development. We hope to have it available to you very soon.
Dictionary of the Academy of the Asturian Language

Published in 2000 after decades of work, this dictionary comprises over fifty thousand entries. Countless people provided invaluable support, from researching etymologies and dialectal forms to collecting words in modern fields such as information technology. The entries are all Copyright © 2000 l’Academia de la Llingua Asturiana which has licensed their use in this program.
To use the dictionary, search for a word in the toolbar.
Note: the conjugator is currently in alpha and may give incorrect forms for irregular verbs.
Many Android devices do not allow you to choose Asturian as a language. This application can be displayed in either Asturian or the system default language.

This application includes a spell checker that you can use in any program on your phone. To activate it, go to Settings → Language and Input → Spell Checker in your device setings. It is not currently stable and you should use it with caution.
Enter some text to spell check…
